item.title: Photo highlights of the day
item.trailText: The Guardian’s picture editors bring you a selection of the best photographs from around the world including the aftermath of the second Nepal earthquake, anti-Shell arctic drilling protests, and Mad Max fans out in force in Sydney
item.standFirst: The Guardian’s picture editors bring you a selection of the best photographs from around the world including the aftermath of the second Nepal earthquake, anti-Shell arctic drilling protests, and Mad Max fans out in force in Sydney

displayImages.caption: Cape Town, South Africa A skateboarder trains late at night under a bridge in the Gardens Skatepark during Building Trust International’s global Playscapes competition, which called for proposals to transform derelict and forgotten slices of land into positive places of play Photograph: Nic Bothma/EPA
displayImages.altText: Cape Town, South Africa: A skateboarder trains late at night under a bridge in the Gardens Skatepark during Building Trust International’s global Playscapes competition, which called for proposals to transform derelict and forgotten slices of land into positive places of play
displayImages.cleanCaption: Cape Town, South Africa A skateboarder trains late at night under a bridge in the Gardens Skatepark during Building Trust International’s global Playscapes competition, which called for proposals to transform derelict and forgotten slices of land into positive places of play

displayImages.caption: Mediterranean Sea HMS Bulwark prepares for survivors to board after their rescue. The Royal Navy’s flagship is said to be helping a significant number of migrants after its latest rescue mission Photograph: Carl Osmond/PA
displayImages.altText: Mediterranean Sea: HMS Bulwark prepares for survivors to come on board after their rescue. The Royal Navy’s flagship is said to be helping a significant number of migrants after its latest rescue mission
displayImages.cleanCaption: Mediterranean Sea HMS Bulwark prepares for survivors to board after their rescue. The Royal Navy’s flagship is said to be helping a significant number of migrants after its latest rescue mission

displayImages.caption: Kathmandu, Nepal Residents of one of the city’s oldest quarters sleep out in a square, after the second earthquake to strike the Himalayan nation Photograph: Roberto Schmidt/AFP/Getty Images
displayImages.altText: Kathmandu, Nepal: Residents of one of the city’s oldest quarters sleep out in a square, in the wake of a second earthquake to strike the Himalayan nation
displayImages.cleanCaption: Kathmandu, Nepal Residents of one of the city’s oldest quarters sleep out in a square, after the second earthquake to strike the Himalayan nation

displayImages.caption: Kathmandu, Nepal People queue for aid. Traumatised survivors spent the night outdoors, afraid to return to their houses after the 7.3-magnitude quake hit yesterday. Photograph: Jay Shaw Baker/NurPhoto/Corbis
displayImages.altText: Kathmandu, Nepal: People queue for aid. Traumatised survivors spent the night outdoors, afraid to return to their houses after the 7.3-magnitude quake hit yesterday.
displayImages.cleanCaption: Kathmandu, Nepal People queue for aid. Traumatised survivors spent the night outdoors, afraid to return to their houses after the 7.3-magnitude quake hit yesterday.

displayImages.caption: Washington, US Activist Jordan Van Voast, of Seattle, paddles his kayak at the base of the Noble Discoverer oil drilling ship after docking at Port of Everett. Despite a Seattle port commission request that Royal Dutch Shell delay moorage of oil exploration vessels in the city pending further legal review, a spokesman said the company will bring its rigs to a terminal as planned to prepare for exploratory drilling in Arctic waters Photograph: Ian Terry/AP
displayImages.altText: Washington, US: Jordan Van Voast, of Seattle, paddles his kayak at the base of the Noble Discoverer oil drilling ship after docking at Port of Everett
displayImages.cleanCaption: Washington, US Activist Jordan Van Voast, of Seattle, paddles his kayak at the base of the Noble Discoverer oil drilling ship after docking at Port of Everett. Despite a Seattle port commission request that Royal Dutch Shell delay moorage of oil exploration vessels in the city pending further legal review, a spokesman said the company will bring its rigs to a terminal as planned to prepare for exploratory drilling in Arctic waters

displayImages.caption: Madrid, Spain Bullfighter Juan del Alamo performs with a Pedraza de Yelte’s ranch fighting bull during a bullfight at Las Ventas bullring Photograph: Daniel Ochoa de Olza/AP
displayImages.altText: Madrid, Spain: Spanish bullfighter Juan del Alamo performs with a Pedraza de Yelte’s ranch fighting bull during a bullfight at Las Ventas bullring
displayImages.cleanCaption: Madrid, Spain Bullfighter Juan del Alamo performs with a Pedraza de Yelte’s ranch fighting bull during a bullfight at Las Ventas bullring

displayImages.caption: Bujumbura, Burundi Demonstrators protest the president’s bid to stand for a third term. A top Burundian general announced today the overthrow of President Pierre Nkurunziza, following weeks of violent protests Photograph: Landry Nshimiye/AFP/Getty Images
displayImages.altText: Bujumbura, Burundi: Demonstrators protest the president’s bid to stand for a third term. A top Burundian general announced today the overthrow of President Pierre Nkurunziza, following weeks of violent protests
displayImages.cleanCaption: Bujumbura, Burundi Demonstrators protest the president’s bid to stand for a third term. A top Burundian general announced today the overthrow of President Pierre Nkurunziza, following weeks of violent protests

displayImages.caption: Hyderabad, Pakistan Students at Primary Qazi Abdul Qayoom Medium school pray for the dozens of victims of the Karachi bus attack carried out by gunmen on motorcycles Photograph: Rajput Yasir/Demotix/Corbis
displayImages.altText: Hyderabad, Pakistan: Students at Primary Qazi Abdul Qayoom Medium school pray for the dozens of victims of the Karachi bus attack carried out by gunmen on motorcycles
displayImages.cleanCaption: Hyderabad, Pakistan Students at Primary Qazi Abdul Qayoom Medium school pray for the dozens of victims of the Karachi bus attack carried out by gunmen on motorcycles

displayImages.caption: Seoul, South Korea A boy holds lanterns during a lighting ceremony at the Jogye temple to celebrate the Buddha’s forthcoming birthday on 25 May Photograph: Ahn Young-joon/AP
displayImages.altText: Seoul, South Korea: A young boy holds lanterns during a lighting ceremony at the Jogye temple to celebrate the Buddha’s upcoming birthday on 25 May
displayImages.cleanCaption: Seoul, South Korea A boy holds lanterns during a lighting ceremony at the Jogye temple to celebrate the Buddha’s forthcoming birthday on 25 May

displayImages.caption: London, UK A man plays guitar in the sun in St James’s Park as the temperature in London is predicted to reach a high of 20C (68F) Photograph: Carl Court/Getty Images
displayImages.altText: London, UK A man plays guitar in the sun in St James’s Park as the temperature in London is predicted to reach a high of 20C (68F)
displayImages.cleanCaption: London, UK A man plays guitar in the sun in St James’s Park as the temperature in London is predicted to reach a high of 20C (68F)

displayImages.caption: Cannes, France Director Emmanuelle Bercot poses during the photocall for La Tête Haute at the 68th annual Cannes film festival Photograph: Franck Robichon/EPA
displayImages.altText: Cannes, France: Director Emmanuelle Bercot poses during the photocall for La Tete Haute at the 68th annual Cannes Film Festival
displayImages.cleanCaption: Cannes, France Director Emmanuelle Bercot poses during the photocall for La Tête Haute at the 68th annual Cannes film festival

displayImages.caption: Anhui province, China Paramilitary policemen jump during a training session in muddy water at a military base in Chuzhou Photograph: China Daily/Reuters
displayImages.altText: Paramilitary policemen jump during a training session in muddy water at a military base in Chuzhou
displayImages.cleanCaption: Anhui province, China Paramilitary policemen jump during a training session in muddy water at a military base in Chuzhou

displayImages.caption: Sydney, Australia Thousands of fans gather on the Sydney Opera House forecourt steps to watch the cast of Mad Max: Fury Road during a promotional event Photograph: Dean Lewins/AAP
displayImages.altText: Sydney, Australia: Thousands of fans gather on the Sydney Opera House forecourt steps to watch the cast of Mad Max: Fury Road during a promotional event
displayImages.cleanCaption: Sydney, Australia Thousands of fans gather on the Sydney Opera House forecourt steps to watch the cast of Mad Max: Fury Road during a promotional event

displayImages.caption: Gaza Strip Palestinians attend the film festival Red Carpet in el-Shuja’ia neighbourhood. The festival was held in the Gaza Strip on the debris of the homes that were destroyed during last summer’s Israeli offensive on the blockaded territory Photograph: Emad Drimly/Xinhua Press/Corbis
displayImages.altText: Gaza Strip Palestinians attend the film festival Red Carpet in el-Shuja’ia neighborhood. The festival was held in the Gaza Strip on the debris of the homes that were destroyed during last summer’s Israeli offensive on the blockaded territory
displayImages.cleanCaption: Gaza Strip Palestinians attend the film festival Red Carpet in el-Shuja’ia neighbourhood. The festival was held in the Gaza Strip on the debris of the homes that were destroyed during last summer’s Israeli offensive on the blockaded territory
